children.value: Users can enter or edit text in the text box.
to bidirectionally bind the value of the input box, and use

props.code:
import { ref } from 'vue'
const value = ref('')

children.value: Different types of input boxes are defined according to the

props.code:
<!-- Enter any text -->
   <z-field v-model="text" label="text" />
   <!-- Enter the mobile phone number and bring up the mobile phone number keyboard -->
   <z-field v-model="tel" type="tel" label="Mobile phone number" />
   <!-- Allow the input of positive integers and bring up the pure numeric keyboard -->
   <z-field v-model="digit" type="digit" label="integer" />
   <!-- Allows you to enter numbers and calls up a pure numeric keyboard with symbols -->
   <z-field v-model="number" type="number" label="number" />
   <!-- Enter password -->
   <z-field v-model="password" type="password" label="password" />

children.value: <!-- Enter the mobile phone number and bring up the mobile phone number keyboard -->
<!-- Allow the input of positive integers and bring up the pure numeric keyboard -->
<!-- Allows you to enter numbers and calls up a pure numeric keyboard with symbols -->
to set the input box to a read-only state, and use
to set the input box to a disabled state.

props.code:
<z-field label="Text" model-value="Input box read-only" readonly />
   <z-field label="text" model-value="Input box is disabled" disabled />

children.value: Configure the icons on both sides of the input box through
, and display the clear icon during the input process by setting

props.code:
<z-cell-group inset>
   <z-field
     v-model="value1"
     label="text"
     left-icon="detail"
     right-icon="info-circle"
     placeholder="show icon"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="value2"
     clearable
     label="text"
     left-icon="safetycertificate"
     placeholder="Show clear icon"
   />
</z-cell-group>

<z-field
     v-model="username"
     required
     label="username"
     placeholder="Please enter username"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="phone"
     required
     label="mobile phone number"
     placeholder="Please enter your mobile phone number"
   />

children.value: attribute is only used to control style display. When performing form validation, you need to use the
option to control the validation logic.
on the Form component. At this time, all Fields in the Form will automatically determine whether asterisks need to be displayed based on

props.code:
<z-form required="auto">
   <z-field
     v-model="username"
     :rules="[{ required: true }]"
     label="username"
     placeholder="Please enter username"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="phone"
     :rules="[{ required: false }]"
     label="mobile phone number"
     placeholder="Please enter your mobile phone number"
   />
</z-form>

children.value: attribute indicates that this is a required item, and can be used with the
attribute to display the corresponding error prompt.

props.code:
<z-field
     v-model="username"
     error
     label="username"
     placeholder="Please enter username"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="phone"
     label="mobile phone number"
     placeholder="Please enter your mobile phone number"
     error-message="Mobile phone number format error"
   />

children.value: The button slot allows you to insert buttons at the end of the input box.

props.code:
<z-field
     v-model="sms"
     center
     clearable
     label="SMS verification code"
     placeholder="Please enter the SMS verification code"
   >
     <template #button>
       <z-button size="small" type="primary">Send verification code</z-button>
     </template>
   </z-field>

children.value: The input content can be formatted through the
attribute, and the timing of formatting can be specified through the
attribute. By default, formatting is performed during input.

props.code:
<z-field
     v-model="value1"
     label="text"
     :formatter="formatter"
     placeholder="Perform formatting as you type"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="value2"
     label="text"
     :formatter="formatter"
     format-trigger="onBlur"
     placeholder="Perform formatting when out of focus"
   />

// Filter the input numbers
const formatter = (value) => value.replace(/\d/g, '');

children.value: For textarea, height adaptation can be set through the

props.code:
<z-field
     v-model="message"
     rows="1"
     autosize
     label="Message"
     type="textarea"
     placeholder="Please enter a message"
   />

children.value: properties will display the word count at the bottom.

props.code:
<z-field
     v-model="message"
     rows="2"
     autosize
     label="Message"
     type="textarea"
     maxlength="50"
     placeholder="Please enter a message"
     show-word-limit
   />

children.value: The alignment of the input box content can be set through the

props.code:
<z-field
     v-model="value"
     label="text"
     placeholder="Input box content right aligned"
     input-align="right"
   />

children.value: The position of the input box text can be set through the

props.code:
<z-field
     v-model="value"
     label="text"
     placeholder="top alignment"
     label-align="top"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="value2"
     label="text"
     placeholder="left aligned"
     label-align="left"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="value3"
     label="text"
     placeholder="center aligned"
     label-align="center"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="value4"
     label="text"
     placeholder="right aligned"
     label-align="right"
   />

Customize the text on the left side of the input box

The component provides the following CSS variables, which can be used to customize styles. For usage, please refer to

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
